timeline.bodyText:
please remove public from the fields. It just clutters the examples.
please do the same in all examples.
timeline.author: baratali
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -79,14 +79,204 @@ * <module name="ClassFanOutComplexity"/> * *

- * To configure the check with a threshold of 10: + * Code examples: + *

+ * The check passes without violations in the following. + *

+ * 
+ * public class InputClassComplexity {
+ *   public Set _set = new HashSet(); // Ignored due to default excludedClasses property
+ *   public Map _map = new HashMap(); // Ignored due to default excludedClasses property
+ *   public Date _date = new Date(); // Counted, 1
+ *   public Time _time = new Time(); // Counted, 2
+ *   public Place _place = new Place(); // Counted, 3
+ * }
+ *
+ *

+ * The check results in a violation in the following. + *

+ * 
+ * public class InputClassComplexity {
+ *   public Set _set = new HashSet(); // Ignored due to default excludedClasses property

+ *   <property name="excludedClasses" value="HashMap, HashSet, Place"/>
  * </module>
  *
*

+ * Code examples: + *

+ *

+ * The check passes without violations in the following. + *

+ * 
+ * class InputClassComplexity {
+ *   Set set = new HashSet(); // Set counted 1, HashSet ignored
+ *   Map map = new HashMap(); // Map counted 2, HashMap ignored
+ *   Date date = new Date(); // Counted, 3
+ *   Time time = new Time(); // Counted, 4
+ *   // mention of 16 other user defined classes
+ *   // Counted, 20
+ *   Place place = new Place(); // Ignored
+ * }
+ *
+ *

+ * The check results in a violation in the following. + *

+ * 
+ * class InputClassComplexity {
+ *   Set set = new HashSet(); // Set counted 1, HashSet ignored
+ *   Map map = new HashMap(); // Map counted 2, HashMap ignored
+ *   Date date = new Date(); // Counted, 3
+ *   Time time = new Time(); // Counted, 4
+ *   // mention of 16 other user defined classes
+ *   // Counted, 20
+ *   Space space = new Space(); // Violation
+ * }
+ *
+ *

+ * To configure the check to exclude classes with a regular expression + * {@code .*Reader$}: + *

+ * 
+ * <module name="ClassFanOutComplexity">
+ *   <property name="excludeClassesRegexps" value=".*Reader$"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

+ * Code examples: + *

+ *

+ * The check passes without violations in the following. + *

+ * 
+ * class InputClassComplexity {
+ *   Set set = new HashSet(); // Ignored due to default excludedClasses property
+ *   Map map = new HashMap(); // Ignored due to default excludedClasses property
+ *   Date date = new Date(); // Counted, 1
+ *   Time time = new Time(); // Counted, 2
+ *   // mention of 18 other user defined classes
+ *   // Counted, 20
+ *   BufferedReader br; // Ignored
+ * }
+ *
+ *

+ * The check results in a violation in the following. + *

+ * 
+ * class InputClassComplexity {
+ *   Set set = new HashSet(); // Ignored due to default excludedClasses property
+ *   Map map = new HashMap(); // Ignored due to default excludedClasses property
+ *   Date date = new Date(); // Counted, 1
+ *   Time time = new Time(); // Counted, 2
+ *   // mention of 18 other user defined classes
+ *   // Counted, 20
+ *   File file; // Violation
+ * }
+ *
+ *

+ * To configure the check with an excluded package {@code java.io}: + *

+ * 
+ * <module name="ClassFanOutComplexity">
+ *   <property name="excludedPackages" value="java.io"/>
+ * </module>
+ *
+ *

+ * Code examples: + *

+ *

+ * The check passes without violations in the following. + *

+ * 
+ * import java.io.BufferedReader;
+ *
+ * class InputClassComplexity {
+ *   Set set = new HashSet(); // Ignored due to default excludedClasses property
+ *   Map map = new HashMap(); // Ignored due to default excludedClasses property
+ *   Date date = new Date(); // Counted, 1
+ *   Time time = new Time(); // Counted, 2
+ *   // mention of 18 other user defined classes
+ *   // Counted, 20
+ *   BufferedReader br; // Ignored
+ * }
+ *
+ *

+ * The check results in a violation in the following. + *

+ * 
+ * import java.util.StringTokenizer;
+ *
+ * class InputClassComplexity {
+ *   Set set = new HashSet(); // Ignored due to default excludedClasses property
+ *   Map map = new HashMap(); // Ignored due to default excludedClasses property
